This week, instead of a recipe, I shared a heartbreak and a vulnerable Hope Story with you. SCUSE ME, WHAT IS SHE DOING? This is a food blog. People come here for recipes, not pictures of babies. I was totally terrified that this would not land, but that little sparkle of hope that we could make an Internet miracle happen together was too bright for me to ignore.

what happened next :: I SAT IN THE FRONT ROW AND WATCHED YOU STAND IN THE GAP FOR BABIES WITHOUT FAMILIES. You started showing up and dominating this dream with your big, amazing food-loving hearts.

You said: we want food for everyone.

You said: there's enough room at our table.

You said: we see children without homes and we ascribe them UNSURPASSABLE WORTH.

In three days, you've almost doubled the initial goal. DOUBLED!!!! Think about that: With $35,000 and counting, you're holding space for 30+ orphans in the Philippines to have a home, a full meal, and a place at the table for one whole year. My friends have been texting me emoji-overloaded messages of "PINCH OF YUM READERS ARE AMAZING!" My mascara gets a little sloppy every time I read your updated tributes on the Hero Roster. <-- (if you read nothing else, read this.)

With 1 1/2 days left in the challenge, we still have power to open doors for more littles. There's still room. We ascribe unsurpassable worth in one of the most regular of ways - by bringing the food. It's rice, it's fish, it's fresh vegetables. It's nutritious formula for the babies, and spaghetti and fried chicken and juicy mangoes for the birthday parties.

Can I just say - I probably love you more than what's normal, and I so deeply adore everything we're about. ❤️ Spring Roll Bowls, Chocolate Chip Cookies, and LOVE.

TO JOIN OUR FOOD-BRINGING TEAM: tap the link in my profile.

TO HAVE YOUR MASCARA RUINED: read the moving tributes from readers on the Hero Roster.

Just a quick PSA: the time for bacon wrapped dates stuffed with goat cheese is ALWAYS.
On the first ever night of my dinner club this year, my friend brought these dates - life will never be the same. Formal dinner parties, casual holiday get togethers, or cozy movie nights in watching the snow fall (that was last night for us ❤️)... there can never be a wrong time for these bite-sized three-ingredient wonders. Prepare for your house to smell like straight up holiday heaven.

Just remove the pit of the date, stuff with goat cheese, wrap with bacon, and bake at 425 for about 15 minutes.
And JUST A THOUGHT: you could take them to the next level by glazing with bourbon honey and sprinkling with sea salt. 😭💋🙏🏼 you could and you should.
Sponsored by @wrightbrandbacon - we picked up their Smoked Bacon from Target and it works like a dream in this combo! Check out their website for more bacon genius.

What's your favorite way to use bacon around the holidays? ...please say these dates.

poke bowl! 🍣 or, if you're not into raw fish, tofu-poke bowl! 🌿 15 minutes easy and so super fresh. summer, we're ready for u. ✌🏼
.
shake in a jar:
1/4 c soy sauce (tamari for gf)
2 tbsp honey
2 tbsp rice vinegar
2 tbsp sesame seeds
.

toss with:
1/2 lb tuna, tofu, or any sushi grade fish, cut into cubes
3 green onions, sliced
1/2 jalapeño, minced
.
marinate for a while (10 minutes minimum) and serve with rice, avocado, green onion, sesame seeds and spicy mayo! sushi dreams coming true.
.

if you're going with tuna, a) YAY 😍 and b) make sure to find a good grocery that carries high quality, sushi grade fish. here in Minneapolis/St. Paul we got ours from @coastalseafoodsmn. I think Whole Foods usually has a pretty decent selection, too. 👌🏼

ummm yes. this is a real thing. pumpkin alfredo ❤️‼️ five ingredients because simple = best. THE ULTIMATE fall comfort food.

sauce:
2 tablespoons butter
5 garlic cloves, minced
1 cup pumpkin puree
2 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream (it’s a splurge, okay?)
1/2 cup grated Parm
.
melt butter over medium heat and saute garlic until soft. add pumpkin and whipping cream and simmer until thickened, then add cheese and stir to combine. boil 8-12 ounces of pasta and toss with the sauce. yums!

chickpeas - love or hate? these moroccan-spiced chickpeas have made me reconsider my feelings. 🤩 build your own salad bowls with this stuff, or, if you're me, just scoop out the chickpeas with a warm piece of pita bread. yeah, did that. ⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
you'll need:⠀
1 tablespoon olive oil⠀
1/4 cup chopped onion⠀
1 clove garlic, minced⠀
1 tablespoon each – chili powder and cumin⠀
1 teaspoon each – turmeric and garam masala⠀
1 teaspoon sea salt⠀
dash of each - cinnamon and cayenne⠀
2 14-ounce cans chickpeas⠀
2 14-ounce cans fire roasted diced tomatoes⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the onion; saute until soft. add the garlic, spices, salt, and chickpeas – stir until very fragrant. add the tomatoes (undrained) and simmer for 20 minutes.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
serve the chickpea mixture with all your fave health things and a boatload of herbs (mint, parsley, cilantro). yum!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

💪🏼💪🏽💪🏾 post-workout tart cherry power cubes are a) the most fun workout drink ever, and b) packed with all kinds of tasty natural anti-inflammatory helpers - like @choosecherries montmorency tart cherry concentrate, coconut water, ginger, and turmeric.
.
just mix it up, freeze it in cubes, and add to some coconut water for a quick, easy drink to help with soreness and speed up your recovery.
.
ingredients:
1/2 cup Montmorency tart cherry concentrate
1 cup coconut water
1 tsp turmeric
1 tbsp ginger paste
.
mix well and set in the freezer overnight. add to your fav coconut water and enjoy!

sponsored by @choosecherries. visit choosecherries.com for more delicious and nutritious tart cherry recipes.

halloo SPICY CHEESE BREAD. um, guys, can you even believe this right now ‼️ this bread is perfect for your fall and winter soups, and it works great with the spicy cheeses because you get both the kick of heat and the comfort of soft, pillowy bread. win for you and win for your friends on the receiving end of your soup / bread mastery.
.

Here’s how to make it:
.

GOOD BREAD DOUGH (we used the miracle no-knead bread, obvi. google it!)
6oz sliced pepperjack cheese
6oz shredded mozzarella cheese
1 beaten egg
red pepper flakes
.

Roll the bread dough into a 15x20” rectangle. Top with cheese and red pepper flakes. Starting with the long side, roll the dough into a log. Roll the log into a coil, tucking the end underneath. Brush the loaf with the egg wash and sprinkle (again) with red pepper flakes. Transfer to a round 9 inch pan. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 20-30 minutes until browned. It will be less crispy than the traditional no knead bread and more like a yummy cheesy soft dense focaccia type bread. and it shall blow your mind.
.

recipe sponsored by @sargentocheese - we used both their shreds and slices to make that perfectly even, melty cheese layer 😍🧀

hello pumpkin walnut chili! ❤️ this beauty is a yummy vegan powerhouse!! featuring red lentils, tomatoes, walnuts, black beans, pumpkin, chipotles, and all the good toppings. love love love this stuff.
.
in the instant pot:
1 28-ounce can fire-roasted tomatoes
half an onion, minced
3 cloves garlic, minced
2 poblano peppers, chopped
2-3 chipotle peppers, chopped
2 cups walnuts, chopped
1 cup red lentils
1 cup bulgur
2 tablespoons chili powder
1 tablespoons smoked paprika
1 tablespoon salt
6 cups water or broth (refill the tomato can about 2x)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cook all ingredients on soup mode for 30 mins. release the steam, stir in the a 14-oz can of pumpkin puree and two 14-oz cans of black beans, and top it off with avocado and cilantro and the gang.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
can also be made quite easily on the stovetop or in the slow cooker - alternate directions in blog post! happy lunching ✌🏼
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

PUMPKIN PARTY DESSERT, because anything made with pumpkin and yellow cake mix and butter (and good friends) is LIFE. my mom made this around the holidays every year growing up and it is my favorite thing ever - a pumpkin pie-like base topped with a buttery yellow cake layer that lays on top gets baked right in. 💙
.

this year we’re gearing up to make this for a Friendsgiving that I'm hosting with my dinner club friends. who are your friendsgiving peeps? your prep squad? your pumpkin party dessert eaters? tag them and get busy!
.

PUMPKIN PARTY DESSERT
1 can pumpkin (15 oz)
1 can evaporated milk (12 oz)
1 cup white sugar
½ cup brown sugar
4 beaten eggs
1 tsp. cinnamon
¼ tsp. salt
¼ tsp. ginger
½ tsp. cloves

Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Pour into a 9 X 13 pan.

Sprinkle 1 package dry yellow cake mix over top and pour 1 cup of melted butter evenly over the top.

Bake at 375 degrees for about 1½ hours or until the middle is set.
.

new holiday tradition: baked brie bites with cherry dipping sauce! 💋🎄✨ the cutest little appetizer that’s savory/sweet/tart thanks to the red wine / balsamic / cherry combo. And bonus - choosing Montmorency tart cherries (which are U.S.-grown) can help support local agriculture and preserve generations-old family farms. Win win.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
ingredients:
1 cup dried Montmorency tart cherries
1/2 cup red wine
1/4 cup balsamic vinegar
1 1/4 cup water
11/2 tbsp sornstarch, mixed with water
honey, salt, pepper to taste
2 sheets puff pastry dough, cut into 3-inch squares
18 mini wheels of Brie cheese
1 egg, beaten
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the sauce:
1. pour boiling water over the cherries and let them plump up for 30 mins, drain water
2. simmer red wine and balsamic until reduced, about 5 mins
3. add tart cherries and cornstarch dissolved in water, simmer another 5 mins
4. season to taste with salt, pepper and honey
5. let cool before serving
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the brie bites:
1. wrap cheese wheels in 3in sections of pastry dough, pinching at the top to seal
2. brush with egg
3. bake at 400° for 20 minutes
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
recipe sponsored by @choosecherries 🍒❤️

5 ingredient super soft peanut butter cookies! ♡ NO FLOUR NECESSARY. from my fave @cookieandkate 😘 and her new all vegetarian, all real food cookbook. all you need is peanut butter, eggs, coconut sugar (or brown sugar), salt, and vanilla. they are crackly/salty on top and super soft and chewy and life changing on the inside.
.
INGREDIENTS 👇🏼
• 2 cups lightly packed coconut sugar
• 2 eggs
• 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
• 1/4 teaspoon salt
• 1 16-ounce jar creamy peanut butter (1 1/4 cups)
• 1 cup chocolate chips
.

make them tiny so they bake all the way through - like 25-30 for the whole batch (recipe says 40 but I like mine to be XL/tiny) ☺️
.

this video was shot while the cookies were still warm, but I looove these stored in the fridge so they're cold but still soft and chewy when you eat them. they've become a major summer essential in our life and we keep a bag in the freezer at the studio at all times.
.

recipe is from the new Love Real Food cookbook by my friend Kathryne @cookieandkate 🍪 which is amazing and you should get it! also her insta account has tons of amazing vegetarian recipes and cute dog photos going on over there for those of you who are into that kinda thing. (MEEE.)

how to win wednesday: this easy mexican quinoa casserole! 🏆❤️💪🏼 it's piled high with blistered peppers, salsa-ified quinoa, black beans, and Pepperjack cheese. bonus: it makes the BEST leftovers.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix up in a bowl:
1 1/2 cups uncooked quinoa
1 14 ounce can cooked black beans, rinsed and drained
1 1/2 cups salsa
1 1/2 cups chicken broth
1/2 teaspoon salt
1-2 cloves minced garlic
1/2 cup shredded cheese
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
add the mixture to a greased 9x13 pan and bake for one hour at 375.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
meanwhile, heat some oil in a skillet and sauté 1 minced jalapeño, 1 sliced onion, and 4 sliced bell peppers until tender-crisp. set aside until the quinoa is done, and then top it on with 1 cup of cheese and bake for an additional 5-10 mins.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Broccoli, creamy cheddar, white beans, sautéed garlic, almonds, and brown rice: today's randomly delicious 30 minute
Applyicious. Or something. 🍎❤

Easy Crockpot Carnitas! this is by far one of my most-made recipes from the blog (I mean, like, I personally make them a lot. 🌮🌮🌮 and so do you guys!). I make these when we have friends over because they can be made ahead and left to do their thing in the crockpot all day. also because this recipe makes a lotta carnitas.
.
pro tip 1: broil it in the oven at the end for the most amazing golden brown crispy bits. pro tip 2: go diva style. use every possible topping. 👌🏼
.
IN THE CROCKPOT:
4-5 lbs. boneless pork shoulder
5 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon salt
1 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon chili powder
1 teaspoon black pepper
1 teaspoon oregano
¼ teaspoon cinnamon
½ teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 tablespoon chipotle hot sauce
juice of 2 limes
½ cup orange juice
12 ounces light beer
½ cup salsa
.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours, shred the meat, and broil in the oven for 5-10 minutes. Assemble, devour, 👅👅👅.
.

VEGETARIAN MEATBALLS! 👊🏼 made with cauliflower, quinoa, brown rice, garlic, and spices. This recipe is SUPER versatile and makes a huge batch so you can stockpile them in your freezer for easy meals all winter.
.
CAULIFLOWER:
Cook 3 cups cauliflower florets in a pot of boiling water for about 5 mins. Drain well.
.
MIX:
Pulse the cauliflower and 3 cups quinoa/rice through a food processor. Transfer to a large mixing bowl and combine with 3/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1 tbsp spices, 2 tsp salt, and 4 eggs. Roll into small balls.
.
COOK:
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat - add the balls and cook. Serve with sauces, salads, bowls, or freeze for later! We love topping these with Life-Changing 30 Minute Masala Sauce. 👌🏼
.

tag someone who needs a margarita ✌🏼this is how I make basic margs for a crowd! 👅 it's my party go-to in the summer and the only way I ever really make margaritas... the 1-2-3 method! 1 part simple syrup, 2 parts lime juice, and 3 parts tequila... and a lot of ice, and a little salt, and a big group of friends. easy. the end.
.
simple syrup:
heat 1 part water to 1 part sugar in a pan until dissolved.
.
in the pitcher:
1 part simple syrup
2 parts fresh lime juice
3 parts tequila

serve over ice and give it a good stir, otherwise they're gonna be super strong 😬😂 don't forget to salt your rims, too.
.
pro tip: a juicer helps A LOT. if you don't want to juice all those limes, use frozen limeade concentrate. also - if you measure 1 part as 1 cup, the whole thing will serve about 8-10 margaritas.
.

last Friday, our friends invited us for dinner, and as we got in the car, I told Bjork: I don't think I can do it. I feel dead. I have nothing in me. I'm at a zero. but we did it anyway - we went and we ate veggie fajitas on homemade tortillas (perks of being friends with @thefauxmartha) and within a few minutes of eating, I started feeling better. like myself again. a little more alive. as we left, Bjork said: it seems like you really needed to eat a good meal.
.

that is the spirit of the Feeding a Broken Heart series. that is the real life thing that is happening STILL in my life right now. and that's why this series matters to me.
.

we wrapped up our FABH series this week, so in honor of you all, here's one last round of love for everyone who participated in our challenge to take care of others by feeding them a good meal. thank you for being so supportive to us after losing Afton, and for being so supportive of the others in your life who needed a little something extra to help them make it through. this has been so life-giving for us.
.

I'm kind of a delicate soul these days, but true story: I sat at my computer yesterday and opened an email with a picture of an elderly gentleman wearing big glasses and a sweatshirt with "DAD" across the front, smiling with his birthday cake and candle, sent to me by a reader who wanted to share that she had made him a POY recipe. and I cried. I am so lucky to get to do this weird food + writing thing for a job and even more lucky to have an amazingly loving community of people to do it with and for.
.

to those of you who are sitting in the middle of your own hard place right now, who are dreading a holiday weekend, whose hearts are bleeding out silently, please feed yourself something so comforting from this series and feel our love coming through for you. I'm totally in the trenches of grief, confusion, depression, and loss right there with you. this is so blah and so hard and extremely un-fun. but we're not alone. and speaking from experience: food can help. ❤ take good care of yourself.
.

to follow more of our personal story: @lindsaymostrom
.

everything greek pork pitas! 👅 hullooo lover! juicy peppery pork with dat tzatziki, parsley, sun dried tomato, feta, and lemon juice. works in the Instant Pot or in a slow cooker, like we do.
.
BRING IT ON:
3 pounds pork shoulder, fat trimmed
1 onion, chopped
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon oregano
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon onion powder
1 teaspoon black pepper
.
see? so easy. place all ingredients for the pork in a slow cooker on low heat for 10-12 hours, OR in an Instant Pot on the meat/stew setting (about 45 minutes). assemble your pitas and top with shredded meat, tzatziki, lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, feta, lemon, etc.
.

FYI tzatziki is really easy to make but I've been known to cheat and buy it at Trader Joe's. really good. ✌🏼
.

pro tip: wrap in foil and pop in the oven for a few minutes to soften pitas as seen on the vid 💋
.

COCONUT CURRY SOUP, of the anything-you-have variety. seriously this can be made with almost ANY vegetables. ✌🏼 it's silky-smooth and vegan!
.
SAUTE: Heat oil in pan and add 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, and 1 knob ginger. Once softened, add 1 tbsp red curry paste, 2 tbsp turmeric, 1 tsp salt 2 tbsp sugar and sauce until fragrant.
.
BOIL: Add 12 small potatoes, and 24 oz coconut milk, 3 cups broth, and simmer until potatoes have softened.
.
BLEND: Transfer contents of pot to a blender. Blend until smooth.
.
FRY: Press the moisture out of 24 oz tofu, cut into cubes, and fry with oil. Sometimes I add a little bit of soup to get it nice and golden brown.👌🏼
.
Pour the soup into bowls and top with tofu and whatever veggies you liiiike. It's a soup-salad situation and it's YUMMY.
.

hello LOVER! mushroom wild rice soup, made stovetop, slow cooker, or in the instant pot! this can also be made with our without chicken, with or without the mushrooms if you must 😭, but definitely not without a hunk of crusty no knead soup bread. 👅👅👅 some things are non-negotiable.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in the instant pot:
5 medium carrots, chopped
5 stalks celery, chopped
half of an onion, chopped
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 cup uncooked wild rice** not a blend! you gotta use true wild rice
8 ounces fresh mushrooms, sliced
4 cups vegetable or chicken broth
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cook everything for 45 minutes on manual mode and release steam. when the soup is done, melt 6 tbsp of butter in a saucepan and whisk in 1/2 cup flour. let it cook for a few mins and then slowly whisk in 1 1/2 cups milk. mix into the soup and serve! WITH SOUP BREAD.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

.
peel your asparagus into noodles, saute in a hot pan for just 30-ish seconds - you want it to still be kinda crispy, and top with pesto, bacon, peas and cheese.

GENERAL TSO’S CAULIFLOWER ✨ golden brown crispy fried cauliflower tossed in a made-from-scratch spicy sweet sauce. veg lovers unite.
.
SAUCE: Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a pan. Add grated ginger and 3 cloves garlic for a min or two. Add 1/2 cup broth, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/3 cup rice vinegar, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 2 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in water and simmer until thick.
.
BATTER: Whisk 1 cup flour, 2/3 cup cornstarch, 1.5 tsp baking powder, 2 tsp salt, 4 eggs. Thin with water as necessary so it's drippy but coats the cauliflower.
.
FRY: Add oil to a pan over medium heat. Dip cauliflower florets in the batter and set in oil, frying for a few mins on each side until golden brown. Move pieces to a cooling rack.
.
Toss the fried cauliflower with the sauce and serve! 😋
.

first of all, lol to “pasta” and “salad” existing together but we’re from minnesota and this is how we do things around here ✌🏼sorry we don’t make the rules. this pasta salad is noodles and meat and cheese and every other great thing you could possibly think of. pair this situation with a glass of rosé? psshhh, game over.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
blitz up for the dressing:⠀
3/4 cup olive oil⠀
2 tablespoons white vinegar (white vinegar or red wine vinegar work)⠀
2 tablespoons water⠀
1 tablespoon coarse sea salt (less for table salt)⠀
1-2 teaspoons sugar⠀
1 teaspoon dry oregano⠀
1 teaspoon dry basil⠀
1 clove garlic⠀
black pepper to taste⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix dressing in a bowl with:⠀
1 lb. cooked pasta⠀
8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese balls, cut in half⠀
1 lb. summer sausage or salami, cut into chunks⠀
3 cups cherry tomatoes, cut in half⠀
3/4 cup black olives, sliced⠀
1/4 cup minced fresh parsley⠀
sliced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, pepperoncini (optional)⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

👆🏼crockpot chicken wild rice soup: for sure my most frequently made blog recipe of all time. I have this one legit memorized, guys. it is a fall / winter treasure that I make every time we have people over because I can just start it in the morning and walk in after work to find a COMPLETED DINNER. hello lover. that crockpot sure knows us.
.

just a gentle suggestion but the miracle no knead bread? with this? I mean.... yeah. meant to be.
.

IN CROCKPOT:
1 cup uncooked wild rice
1 pound chicken breasts
2 cups mixed chopped celery, carrots, and onions
6 cups chicken broth
1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
.

IN SAUCEPAN:
½ cup butter
¾ cup flour
2 cups whole milk
.

MIX AND ADD IN:
salt to taste
a few tablespoons white wine (optional)
up to 2 cups additional milk or water to thin it out .
.

guys, can we talk about a truly life changing way to eat brussels sprouts? 💯 it's all about those papery shaved brussels shreds (please tell me you're familiar with this amazing trick? the mandoline is your friend with this, and now they also sell them pre-shaved which is 👌🏼) and then obvi we're tossing this with bacon and parm and almonds, OH and then with the shallot citrus olive oil dressing? ugh, seriously. way too good. it's perfectly understated and so great for thanksgiving because it goes with anything and everyone loves it.
.

you can definitely make this ahead - just prep everything and toss together 15-30 minutes before serving. .
.

I have to tell you, my mom made this last night for a lil pre-thanksgiving meal and I was giving major thanks for such a fun and versatile veg. I adore this salad to the max and it has earned a permanent place on our holiday table. ✨
.

DRESSING:
juice of one lemon
juice of one orange
2-3 tablespoons apple cider (not vinegar, just regular apple cider! or something to add sweetness)
1 shallot, minced
½ cup olive oil
½ teaspoon salt and pepper to taste
.

SALAD:
4 dozen brussels sprouts, shaved paper thin (see video)
1 cup chopped almonds
6 slices cooked bacon, crumbled
1 cup grated Parmesan cheese (Asiago or Gruyere are also good)
.

calling all compassionate food lovers! ❤️ 1 in 6 children in America face hunger and food insecurity. I saw this firsthand with my students when I was a teacher right here in Minneapolis — I’d have kids who would come into school with an empty stomach and kids who left with extra food in their pockets and backpacks because they didn’t know if they’d have food at home for dinner. .
.

because we are a big online community of food people, and because food people are always the best people, today we can do something about it. for every $1 that you and I donate to the @feedingamerica network, Bank of America will donate $2. That is math that I like. .
.

it’s an honor to help spread the word for this awesome initiative — well done, @bankofamerica. click the link in my bio to help put food on empty plates!

drumroll for this falafel made with... wait for it... sweet potato! 👅 not authentic but SUUUUPER yummy! w sweet potato, brown rice, almonds, eggs, salt and flour. pop these guys on a fresh salad with some jalapeño ranch dressing and it’s go time.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the falafel:
1 raw sweet potato, peeled and cut into chunks
1 cup cooked brown rice and/or quinoa
½ cup almonds or other nuts
1 egg
1 teaspoon salt
½ cup flour
oil for frying
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
pulse the sweet potato until finely minced, add the brown rice and almonds and pulse, add the egg and salt and pulse. transfer to a bowl and stir in the flour. form into balls or patties and fry them up! ✌🏼 you can bake them too but they’re less yummy, obviously.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Chopped Thai Salad w Sesame Garlic Dressing! 💥 everybody's favorite including me - 4.8 stars from 77 reviews on this one. a rainbow of power veggies including edamame, bell peppers, kale, cashews, and cilantro tossed with a flavorful made-from-scratch Thai-inspired dressing. ❤️ it's zippy, fresh, and happy.
.
DRESSING
⅓ cup canola oil
3 cloves garlic, peeled
3 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce
2 tablespoons water
2 tablespoons white distilled vinegar
2 tablespoons honey or agave
1 tablespoon sesame oil
1 tablespoon lemongrass or ginger paste
a squeeze of lime juice
.
SALAD
16 ounces frozen shelled edamame
5-6 cups baby kale
3 large carrots
2 bell peppers (1 red, 1 yellow)
1 cup cilantro leaves
3 green onions
¾ cup cashews (if you can find them, Trader Joe's Thai Lime and Chili Cashews are the bomb)
.
whisk the dressing, crush the edamame and cashews, toss and serve!
.

Black Pepper Stir Fried Noodles! 😋 ft. udon noodles, crispy tofu, and the most delicious sauce thanks to this all-natural, pure ground, flavorful black pepper. WIN. 🏆
.
BLEND THE SAUCE:
½ tablespoon @jr_watkins Pure Ground Black Pepper
5-6 tablespoons soy sauce
3 tablespoons mirin
2 tablespoons honey (agave for vegan)
1 1-inch piece ginger
3 cloves garlic
2 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 6 tablespoons water
.
TOFU:
Cut 10 oz tofu into slices and press out excess moisture, then cut into cubes
Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil and stir fry until golden brown
Add a splash of the sauce and cook to your liking
.
ALL TOGETHER NOW:
Remove the tofu and add 8 oz cooked udon noodles and add black pepper sauce immediately
Toss in 2 cups spinach and cook until softened
Remove from heat and top with tofu and sesame seeds
.
recipe video sponsored by @jr_watkins

maple walnut nice cream! you know, just a lil summery somethin to keep your glow going strong. 💅🏼💅🏽💅🏾 sponsored by @cawalnuts. you only need 3 ingredients! frozen bananas, maple syrup, and walnuts.
.
ingredients:
4 bananas, cut into chunks and frozen
2 tbsp maple syrup
1/3 c chopped walnuts
...pinch of salt won't hurt
.
blend frozen banana chunks and maple syrup in a powerful blender until smooth, stir in walnut pieces. pour mixture into a small loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours. scoop and serve with extra walnuts! 👌🏼 salt bae style.

👆🏼😂 HOMEMADE DOG TREATS for Sage and all our neighborhood dog friends! you guys, this treat involves a bacon peanut butter glaze and it is totally serious and I can't stop laughing. .
.

MIX:
1 cup pumpkin
½ cup peanut butter
2 eggs
¼ cup liquid oil (coconut is nice, canola works)
2½ cups whole wheat flour
1 teaspoon baking soda

roll and cut into little dog bone shapes (cookie cutters on Amazon for five bucks) or just make them into tiny little rounds for more low maintenance dog cookies. Bake at 350 / 15 minutes and drizzle with glaze.

GLAZE (WHISK UNTIL SMOOTH):
2 tablespoons bacon grease, melted
¼ cup smooth peanut butter
.

firecracker lettuce wraps! 🔥seriously though, watch what happens when you add the sauce to the tofu. it is magic. here's the recipe right here, kids!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
blend up for the sauce:⠀
1/2 cup peanut butter⠀
1/3 cup low sodium soy sauce⠀
1/3 cup sesame oil⠀
1/4 cup rice vinegar⠀
2 tablespoons chili paste (like sambal oelek) ++ for more firecrackery-ness⠀
2 tablespoons sugar⠀
a small knob of fresh ginger, peeled⠀
a clove of fresh garlic, peeled⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cut tofu, saute, then add half of the sauce until it all crisps up. set aside. add a little more oil and some soaked rice noodles to the pan with the rest of the sauce and toss for a few mins.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
toss the noodles with the tofu, roll it up in lettuce. top with peanuts, cilantro, scallions, lime, and/or sriracha if you want. YUM YUM YUM!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

POWER COMBO. 💪🏼 this avocado kale caesar salad is honestly a life-changer! kale, avocado, and crunchy seeds drenched in a quick creamy avocado caesar dressing that can easily be made vegan if you want. toss some crispy sweet potato fries in for next level status.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
blend up for the dressing:⠀
1 avocado, divided⠀
1/2 cup water⠀
1/4 cup mayonnaise⠀
2 small cloves garlic⠀
2 tablespoons lemon juice⠀
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard⠀
1/2 teaspoon salt⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
toss the dressing with about 5-6 cups of kale, some parmesan, and pepitas. serve with homemade sweet potato fries - directions below!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
peel 4 sweet potatoes and cut into fry-shapes. toss with a teaspoon or two of olive oil and a sprinkle of salt, pepper, and garlic powder. bake for 20 minutes at 450. turn and bake for another 10 minutes or so until crispy.⠀

❤️🙏🏼 SWEET POTATO GNOCCHI bathed in a barely-there garlic sage cream sauce. WAIT FOR THE END SHOT because then you will know the truth: that this is out-of-control yummy. I am so not sorry for putting this late night temptation in front of your eyeballs.
.

watch the video 👆🏼👆🏼 and you'll be a pro in one minute flat. (Update: so many of you emailed and asked for a full written recipe, so here you go!)
.

SWEET POTATO GNOCCHI
1 1-lb sweet potato
1 cup ricotta cheese
1/4 cup Parmesan
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
1 1/4 cup flour (more for dusting)
.

GNOCCHI PREP
1. Mix dough and form into a 9x5 inch loaf
2. Cut slices off the loaf and roll into a "rope"
3. Slice the rope into small pieces - this is your gnocchi
4. Boil until all gnocchi rises to the top
5. Drain and toss gently with a little olive oil .
.

ALL TOGETHER NOW
1. Heat 8 T butter over medium high heat
2. Add gnocchi, sauté until really golden brown
3. Add 3 cloves minced garlic and 5-6 minced sage leaves, sauté until it smells amazing
4. Remove from heat, stir in 1/4 cream and 1/4 cup parmesan
5. Let stand a few minutes to thicken, then serve immediately ❤️❤️❤️
.

it’s almost impossible to smell these cooking and not hyperventilate with excitement so pls know that that’s a very standard reaction. 😱😱😱 you guys have shredded tender, juicy crockpot meat before right? you’re aware of the euphoric high that comes with it? cool cool cool just checking. these easy instant pot carnitas were born p much out of our love for doing just that. plus they’re lights-out delicious. wins all around.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in the instant pot:⠀
4-5 lbs. pork shoulder⠀
5 cloves garlic, minced⠀
1 tablespoon salt⠀
1 teaspoon cumin⠀
1 teaspoon chili powder⠀
1 teaspoon black pepper⠀
1 teaspoon oregano⠀
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon⠀
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper⠀
1 tablespoon chipotle hot sauce⠀
juice of 2 limes⠀
1/2 cup orange juice⠀
12 ounces beer⠀
1/2 cup salsa⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cook on high pressure for 30 mins and shred the pork directly in the instant pot. NEXT LEVEL: transfer the pork onto a linked baking sheet with a little bit of sauce and broil until crispy. 🔥 serve with tortillas and all the fixings!⠀

IN A FOOD PROCESSOR:
1 1/2 cups oats
3/4 cup dried Montmorency tart cherries
1/4 cup almond butter
1 tbsp coconut oil
1/2 cup dark chocolate, white chocolate, or carob chips
(pinch of salt to taste)
.
form into bites and chill for 30 mins. dip in dark chocolate and store in the fridge for your midnight snack!
.
also -> you can always omit or use white choc if you’re worried about the caffeine in the dark chocolate.
.

3 ingredient pizza dough 🍕‼️ all you need is @chobani Greek yogurt, self rising flour, and a lil bit o seasoning. no long wait times - just easy, actually good crust. mind bending.
.
mix these:
3 cups self-rising flour
2 cups Greek yogurt
1 tbsp Italian seasoning
pinch of salt
.

form mixture into a ball and cut into 4 pieces. roll out one piece into a crust and bake for 5 mins at 400. add 1/2 cup sauce, 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese, and toppings and bake for 10 more mins until crisp and ready to eat. repeat for all four pieces to make your pizzas, or freeze the rest of the dough for later. OR GRILL. yes gurl, grill that pizza.
.
fav topping combos:
tomato + fresh mozzarella + basil
mushroom + peppers + black olives
bbq chicken + red onion + cilantro

The Best Detox Crockpot Lentil Soup again! 👆🏼 so creamy, super nutritious, ultra cozy. ❤️ It was made for a Saturday like this.

Here's how it goes:
Toss some carrots, celery, garlic, onions, potatoes, squash, lentils, broth, spices and salt in a slow cooker. Cook for 5-6 hours on high.

Transfer about a third of the soup mixture to a blender and purée with 1/2 cup olive oil (I used rosemary olive oil and it was 👏🏼). Add that back into your slow cooker and stir in some kale and parsley. Give it a splash of red wine vinegar for a little extra something.

At this point you have a creamy delicious detox-friendly soup ready for a week of delicious healthy lunches.

So in other words, YOU WIN AT LIFE.

This post was sponsored by @earthboundfarm! Loved using their organic baby kale and organic frozen butternut squash in this recipe. 👌🏼 on point as usual. http://bit.ly/EarthBound

Introducing our perfect baby, Afton Bjork Ostrom, who was born on December 31, 2016, and who left this world peacefully, laying skin-to-skin in the arms of his mommy and daddy, surrounded by pure love in the early morning hours of January 1, 2017.
.

In the midst of our deep sorrow, we are so full of awe and wonder for having experienced just a tiny taste of his precious sweetness this side of heaven. The moment they placed him skin-to-skin on my chest, something inside of me locked into place. I felt his tiny heart beating right over mine, and in an instant, I knew I loved him more than life itself. It was the most profound moment of my life. In our short time, we fell in love with being his parents. We touched all his fingers and toes, we kissed his sweet, perfect face, and we whispered "I love you's" into his tiny little ears so he could hear and know our voices as we held him and let him go.
.

These moments we had with sweet Afton are also making the ache of losing him all the more crushing. We got just a taste, but we so badly wanted a lifetime of this perfect love. It’s a depth of loss that I've never known – where something so tangibly a part of you is suddenly gone. You can feel that searing emptiness right there in your own body. Afton has left his forever mark on us, and it's our honor to wear that deep scar as the evidence that he was here and he was loved. We'll carry that ache with us for the rest of our lives until we meet him again someday.
.

You're forever perfect and forever loved, baby boy. We'll always, always, always be your mommy and daddy, and you'll always be our sweet Afton.

recipe:

Creole Chicken and Sausage 👅 shredded chicken, smoky sausage, black beans, bell peppers, all simmered up in that spicy tomato sauce? yeah, AMAZING. ✅✅✅
.
IN THE SLOW COOKER:
1 pound chicken breasts
12 ounces smoked Andouille sausage
1 cup chopped onions
2 cloves minced garlic
1¼ cup chicken broth
1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
3 tablespoons tomato paste
½ cup plain tomato sauce
2 teaspoons Creole or cajun seasoning
¼ teaspoon cayenne for 🔥
.
Cook it all in the crockpot for 6-8 hours on low. Shred the chicken, add any extras --> this is the fun part. I like: brown sugar, black beans, bell peppers, almond butter (randomly delicious) - cook for another 20-30 mins just to warm it up. Serve with rice, top with green onions. 👌🏼
.

name one thing cozier than chicken tikka masala ope you can’t. 🤗 are we still allowed to be in the mood for hygge-tasting things even though the calendar is moving on? we’ve managed to recreate our favorite indian-restaurant-takeout-situation chicken tikka masala which was a very “DO YOU BELIEVE IN MIRACLES?!” moment for us. 🙏🏼⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
you'll need:⠀
2 lbs. boneless skinless chicken breasts⠀
1/4 cup masala paste (search it on the blog!)⠀
1/2 cup plain yogurt⠀
1 1/2 cups tomato puree⠀
1 14 ounce can regular coconut milk⠀
rice and cilantro for serving⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
toss together chicken, 1 tbsp masala paste, and the yogurt, and marinate in the fridge for 30 mins. ⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in an instant pot, add the rest of the masala paste, the marinated chicken/yogurt mixture, tomato puree, and coconut milk. cook on the manual setting for 8 mins. use the quick release function when finished.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
serve with rice and cilantro. yums!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

for the pesto:
2 cups spinach
1 cup kale
1 cup basil
¾ cup almonds

¼ cup Parm
½ teaspoon salt
2-3 cloves garlic
juice of 1 lemon
.
mix pesto with:
1 lb cooked pasta
2-3 cups tomatoes
1/2 cup shredded cheese
water as needed to loosen the sauce
.
bake in a covered baking dish for 10-15 mins at 400. enjoy!

the best detox crockpot lentil soup! ✌🏼✨ a nourishing soup for that post-thanksgiving bod that is so super yum. recipe made with onions, garlic, carrots, kale, olive oil, squash, and lentils. vegan / vegetarian / gluten free and one of the blog favorites. anyone made this??
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in the crockpot:
2 cups butternut squash (peeled and cubed)
2 cups carrots (peeled and sliced)
2 cups potatoes (chopped)
2 cups celery (chopped)
1 cup green/brown lentils
3/4 cup yellow split peas (or just use more lentils)
1 onion (chopped)
5 cloves garlic (minced)
8-10 cups vegetable or chicken broth
2 teaspoons herbs de provence or dried herbs you like
1 teaspoon salt (more to taste)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cook in slow cooker on high for 5-6 hours or low for 7-8 hours. once cooked, place 4 cups of soup in a blender with 1/2 cup olive oil and blend until smooth. add back into slow cooker and combine with 2-3 cups kale and 1 cup parsley.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

hello crispy, saucy soy ginger cauliflower! this healthier takeout that's not actually takeout is LIFE-CHANGING.💥🙌🏼 oven-fried crispy cauliflower coated with a sweet/tangy/gingery sticky sauce. served with a pile of hot steamy rice, obviously. full recipe below!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the sauce:⠀
2 tbsp veg oil⠀
4 cloves of garlic (minced)⠀
1/4 c soy sauce⠀
4 tsp rice vinegar⠀
1/4 c sugar ⠀
2 tbsp ginger paste⠀
1/2 cup water ⠀
2 tbsp cornstarch⠀
4 green onions (chopped)⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
saute garlic in oil until fragrant. add soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, ginger paste and water and simmer until bubbling. add cornstarch slurry and green onions. once it’s thickened, set aside.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the cauliflower:⠀
1 cup flour⠀
1 cup water⠀
2 tbsp cornstarch⠀
½ tsp garlic powder⠀
1 head of cauliflower, cut into florets⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix together flour, water, cornstarch, and garlic powder. mix with cauliflower, then remove florets and arrange on baking sheet. bake at 425 for 20 mins, then rearrange and bake for 10 mins more.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix baked cauliflower and sauce, serve with rice, and enjoy!⠀

real food + comfort food = veg shepherd's pie! ❤️ loaded with sautéed mushrooms, carrots, peas and topped with the creamiest, tangiest mashed potatoes with greek yogurt for good measure. healthy, cozy, WIN.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the filling:
2 tablespoons olive oil
3 shallots, minced
16 ounces fresh mushrooms, sliced
6 carrots, peeled and chopped
fresh herbs to taste
2 tablespoons tomato paste
2 tablespoons flour
1/2 cup red wine
1-2 cups veggie broth
1 teaspoon salt
2 cups frozen peas
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the mashed potatoes:
6 Yukon gold potatoes, boiled
1/2 cup full fat greek yogurt
1/4 cup butter or olive oil salt to taste
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in a large, oven-safe pot, saute the shallots in olive oil until fragrant, and then add the veggies until softened. add tomato paste and flour and stir, and then pour in the red wine (sizzzzle) and cook for a few mins. slowly add the broth until it's gravy. season with salt and remove the herbs.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix the potatoes, yogurt, and butter and spread it on the filling in the pan. bake for 15 mins at 350 - broil it at the end to get it nice and crispy!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

no refined sugar here! naturally sweet dark chocolate coconut bites 💋 with a creamy coconut filling (like a mounds bar) topped with dark chocolate. super easy to make AND SO YUMMY!
.
YOU’LL NEED:
2½ cups flaked coconut, unsweetened
¼ cup + 1 tablespoon coconut oil, melted
¼ cup honey
½ teaspoon vanilla
a pinch of sea salt
4 ounces dark chocolate
.
MAKE:
follow video ☺️ and be advised (by me!) that the coconut mixture is tricky to roll sometimes so you might need to chill it first if it's falling apart on you. don't panic if it seems crumbly - that's how it's supposed to be - just gently press together with your palm and it should form a ball that holds up perfectly when chilled 👌🏼 I keep mine in the fridge or freezer. perfect one bite desserts!

Creamy Chicken Quinoa and Broccoli Casserole! Real food meets comfort food. ❤️ from scratch, quick and easy, and a big gentle hug loaded with good-for-you ingredients. .

HOW TO MAKE IT:
1. Mix about 3 cups condensed soup (we use homemade!) with 1 cup water, 1/4 cup cooked bacon, 1 cup uncooked quinoa, and stir to combine
2. Pour mixture into a greased baking dish, top with 1 pound sliced chicken breast, sprinkle with your fav seasoning blend, and bake for 30 mins at 400
4. Top casserole with 3 cups cooked broccoli, 1/4 cup cheese, and bake for 10 more mins
5. Eat & enjoy!
.

early sept --> steel cut oats with date caramel. I repeat: DATE CARAMEL. 🚨🚨🚨 this golden magic is dangerously good, and is the perfect whoa-yes addition to a superfood morning bowl. here’s how I made it:
.

cook steel cut oats. preferably the quaker three minute kind so it doesn’t take forever and a day.
.

soften 6 dates in hot water and blend with about 3/4 cup of water, a drizzle of coconut oil, a pinch of salt, and a little vanilla. stir a little bit into your oats.
.

top with more date caramel and other fruits and superfoody things such as coconut, chia, pistachios, berries, flax, etc. etc. etc.
.

instarecipe sponsored by @quaker - makers of 3 minute steel cut oats! 💪🏼

VEGGIE LASAGNA ... made IN A CROCKPOT 🎉 packed with good-for-you veggies, super easy to make, and made with a handful of simple ingredients. .
WHAT YOU NEED:
(2) 24 ounce jars or cans of Italian tomato sauce
9 uncooked lasagna noodles
24 ounces part-skim ricotta cheese
3-4 cups chopped kale
1 jar of pesto
2 cups shredded Mozzarella
Parmesan cheese for topping
fresh parsley for topping
.
LAYER IN ORDER:
Tomato sauce
Lasagna noodles (broken) to cover the bottom
Ricotta cheese
Kale
Pesto
Mozzarella
Repeat two times and end with sauce > noodles > sauce > Mozzarella
.
COOK:
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 5-6 hours
Turn crockpot off and let it sit for at least an hour
Serve and enjoy!
.

CHOCOLATE BLACKOUT CAKE 🍫💀🎉💋 go shorty, it’s my birthday! and this cake…I mean, LOOK AT IT. s/o to @chobani only natural, non-GMO, plain Greek yogurt for keeping this cake ultramoist and all those other good things we like in our food. pretty sure I’ve been preparing my whole life for this.
.
if you’re wondering if I’m making this to celebrate my birthday this week, you do not even know me at all. OBVIOUSLY YES. I gave it a test run for @thefauxmartha’s birthday last week and became obsessed, so now I’m making it again for myself because everyone likes the girl who brings cake to her own birthday party.
.
INGREDIENTS (seems long, you can do it):
3 c. all-purpose flour
3 c. granulated sugar
1½ c. unsweetened cocoa powder
1 tbsp. baking soda
1½ tsp. baking powder
1½ tsp. salt
4 large eggs
1½ c. Chobani plain whole milk Greek Yogurt
2 c. warm water
1 tablespoon espresso powder
½ c. vegetable oil
1 tbsp. vanilla extract
.
HOW TO: whisk wet, whisk dry, combine together. bake cake in 3 layers, 350 degrees, 35 minutes. frost cake (your fave chocolate frosting will work, mine was cream cheese chocolate frosting duh), grip with cardboard, and roll in chocolate chips. drizzle with melted dark chocolate because YOLO.
.
I will also say —> for best results, chill your frosted cake for 15-30 minutes before chocolate-chipping it. it just makes it a little less messy.
.
recipe sponsored by @chobani ✌🏼
.

✨ULTIMATE CHOCOLATE GRANOLA✨a snack/dessert party w chocolate, almonds, crunchy sugar and a hit of sea salt. also it makes hugely epic clusters thanks to the melted chocolate chips and coconut oil. chocolate lovers UNITE. 👊🏼👊🏾👊🏽
.
YOU’LL NEED:
3 cups rolled oats
1¼ cups sliced raw almonds
¾ cup unsweetened coconut flakes
½ cup cocoa powder
¼ teaspoon salt
½ cup turbinado sugar
⅔ cup melted coconut oil
⅓ cup maple syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla
1½ cups chocolate chips
sea salt for finishing
.
MAKE:
Follow the video 👆🏼
.
BAKE:
Bake for 50 mins at 250 (shake/stir pan halfway through). Once baked, sprinkle chocolate chips over the granola and bake for 5-10 mins more to melt. Sprinkle with remaining sugar / sea salt so it sticks to those melted choc chips. Toss gently then let cool so the chocolate creates nice little clusters for you 💯💯💯
.

meal prepping like it's my job 💪🏼💪🏽💪🏾 with sheet pan garlic ginger chicken and broccoli, which is kinda like takeout, but made without refined sugar. say what? I’m for real. a few dates tossed into the sauce is naturally sweet magic.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
blend together:
3/4 cup low sodium soy sauce
1/2 cup water
1/4 cup white vinegar
1/4 cup oil (olive oil is fine)
a 2-inch knob of fresh ginger (peeled)
4 cloves garlic
4 medjool dates (if you don't have these you can use sugar or honey)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
bake chicken and veggies for about 10 minutes at 425. toss a little sauce on em to get extra yummy.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
NEXT LEVEL (not shown in video but recommended!): simmer your extra sauce over medium low heat until it’s thickened. drizzle it over the finished chicken and broccoli. finish with sesame oil, sesame seeds, or scallions. 👌

a little tang, crunch, and sweetness = tart cherry kale salad. 😍 super fresh and zippy, but hearty enough for winter with the bulgur (or quinoa) and walnuts. and those Montmorency tart cherries! not only super tasty, but packing in a wide range of amazing healthy benefits just in time for National Cherry Month. 🙏
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
salad:
4 cups chopped kale
1/2 cup dried Montmorency tart cherries
2 cups cooked bulgur
1/4 cup chopped red onion
1/2 cup parsley, chopped
1/3 cup walnuts, chopped
4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
dressing:
juice of 2 lemons
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
add the salad ingredients to a large bowl and mix together. shake up the dressing ingredients in a jar. toss everything together and eat!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
sponsored by @choosecherries

me again with another idea for Monday morning: CASHEW COFFEE! because pro tip -- you can just blend cashews straight into your hot coffee and it becomes a creamy, foamy, heaven-sent miracle. total game changer in my coffee life. ❤️‼️ anybody tried it yet?
.

cashew coffee ratios:
2 or so cups of hot coffee
1/4 cup cashews
honey and salt to taste
.

a few notes - I recommend 45 seconds in a high speed blender with the last 15 seconds on super high speed.
.

if you don't have a high speed blender, soaking the cashews will help create a smoother consistency.
.

you can use raw or roasted cashews. we've done both. in this video they were roasted cashews. if they are truly raw it's best to soak them first, and when you soak them be sure to rinse well.
.

if you want an iced cashew coffee, either use a cold brew coffee to blend (and use soaked cashews), or chill your blended mix for a few hours and shake + serve over ice. it is reeeeal good.👌🏼👌🏽👌🏾
.

pumpkin muffs! anybody made these yet? 🙋🏼🙋🏾🙋🏽 sponsored by @chobani. high protein, low sugar with the addition of Greek yogurt, and swapping in oats and maple syrup for the usual flour and sugar. obsessed with these and love seeing all your pics of them on stories! ❤️

.

I usually add a pinch of salt and cinnamon too, and a few chocolate chips, you know, just to be fancy and everything. and a slather of butter, coconut oil, or nut butter on a warm muff doesn't hurt the cause, either.
.

BLEND:
2 cups oats
3 bananas
2 eggs
3/4 cup whole pitted dates
1 teaspoon baking soda
.

BAKE:
in muffin tin at 350 for 15-20 minutes -- voila! wholesome breakfast magic.

pinch of cinnamon / sea salt

LIL MANGO HAND PIES! 👯 I’m throwing these into the mix for the Thanksgiving this year. Either that or I’m just eating them, by myself, right now, as second breakfast. ☕️ Mysteries.
—
PIE CRUST (thanks gma!)
3 1/4 cup flour
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups butter or shortening
3 tablespoons white vinegar
3 tablespoons corn syrup
1/2 cup ice water
—
Mix dry ingredients, cut in butter, slowly add wet ingredients, and chill before rolling out.
—
FILLING
3 mangos
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon flour
—
Combine in a food processor. Watch video for assembly instruction. Brush with a beaten egg, sprinkle with extra turbinado sugar. Bake at 425 degrees for 10-15 minutes.
—
Are mangos not the most versatile, sweet and juicy, and all-around heavenly fruit you've ever eaten? Gah! We are 100% MANGO OBSESSED over here. Our video today is sponsored in collaboration with @mangoboard!

(TAP MORE FOR FULL RECIPE 🤗) Happy Holidays to you! And here comes your LOBSTER FETTUCCINE ALFREDO. Friends, get on this. Get on this right now. Just 5 simple ingredients till your mouth meets the velvety sauce on noodles on lobster combo.
--
ALFREDO SAUCE:
1/4 cup butter
1 cup whipping cream
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
--
Melt the butter, add the whipping cream, stir in the Parmesan until melted and smooth.
--
PASTA + LOBSTER:
Cook 8 ounces (half a box) of fettuccine - enough for 4 people. Steam 4 jumbo lobster tails in a few inches of white wine until cooked. Pull meat off the tails and roughly chop. Toss pasta, sauce, and lobster together. Season with salt and pepper. and then FEEL THE LOVE.
--
This recipe post is sponsored by @ALDIUSA - look for Maine Lobster Tails at your local ALDI (12/16, while supplies last). 👌🏼

sesame soba noodle salad, yep yep yep 💥😛💥 with cucumber, carrot, chicken, soba noodles, and a quick spicy peanut sauce. a noodle salad is my kinda salad.
.
sauce:
3 tablespoons sesame oil
2 tablespoons rice vinegar
2 cloves garlic
1 tablespoon fresh ginger (I use a fresh paste)
½ teaspoon salt
¼ cup peanut butter
3-4 tablespoons water
2-3 tablespoons sesame seeds
½ teaspoon red pepper flakes
.
blend sauce ingredients in a food processor. combine with cooked/shredded chicken, carrots, cucumber, cooked soba noodles, fresh cilantro, sesame seeds, and the rest. 😘😘
.

[sponsored by @cawalnuts] WALNUT CAULI TACO BOWLS 🌮my life just changed in a very big way because walnuts as taco meat is actually amazing. I ate the largest bowl of this for lunch (evidence on my stories) and it was so dang yummy. just pulse the walnuts in a food processor with some cauliflower and smoky chipotle spices, bake it, and eat it like you would eat taco meat.
.
our shoot assistant Krista says that her mom ate a whole taco before realizing that it was meatless! 🌿😂💕
.
FOOD PROCESSOR:
3 cups cauliflower florets
2 cups walnuts
2 (single) chipotles in adobo
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 teaspoon cumin
generous hit of salt and lime juice
.
spread the mixture on a baking sheet / bake for 15 minutes at 350. stir and bake another 15 minutes. assemble in bowls with your favorite taco fixings - such as pico, roasty corn and black bean salsa, and guac.
.
stock your freezer! tacos, quesadillas, nachos... YAY walnuts for being so versatile and delicious. .

pinky promise that this brussels sprout salad is the BEST (green) thanksgiving side. 💛🙏🏼 shaved brussels sprouts, chopped bacon, and a light citrus dressing. drooool. it is the perfect crunchy, tangy sidekick to all the tan/brown mushy thanksgiving foods. I legit make this every year!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
RECIPE 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
dressing:
juice of one lemon
juice of one orange
2-3 tablespoons apple cider
1 shallot, minced
1/2 cup olive oil
1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
shave about 4 dozen brussels sprouts, cook up 6 slices of bacon, and mix it all up with 1 cup almonds, 1 cup parmesan, and the dressing. YUMS.

GOLDEN SOUP! 🤩✨ sooo many of you have already made this - I love seeing your pics of it! it’s cozy, bright, and healing with power-foods like turmeric, cauliflower, and cashews. topped with crispy chickpeas, but obviously. super creamy and soooo good.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
recipe:
2 tablespoons olive oil
half an onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, chopped
1 head of cauliflower, chopped into about 5 cups of chunks or florets
1 cup cashews
1 tablespoon turmeric
7-8 cups water
2 teaspoons salt
a squeeze of lemon juice
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
sauté everything. get it nice and fragrant. add 4 cups of water and simmer until softened. blend it all up, bring it back to the pot and stir in the remaining water (however much it needs), and finish it off with a squeeze of lemon juice.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the chickpeas: drain and rinse 2 14-ounce cans, spread them on a baking sheet, sprinkle with cumin, smoked paprika, turmeric, salt, and olive oil and roast at 400 for 30-40 mins. voila!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

caramelized salmon? legit magic ✨ all you need is salmon, sugar, salt, and 20 minutes. 👌🏼 it's ridiculously easy, and that crunchy brown top? gahhh it's the only way I really love salmon.
.

serve with a crisp green salad and boom. you're a spring dinner overachiever.
.

HOW TO MAKE IT:
Combine 1/2 cup sugar, 2 1/2 tablespoons coarse sea salt (more like 2 TEASPOONS if using table salt! be careful), and some pepper in a shallow bowl. Coat 4 fillets of salmon w mixture on each side. Sauté (high-ish heat) for about 5 mins each side. Sprinkle the top of each salmon filet with a teaspoon or two of additional sugar/salt mixture. Broil for 5-10 mins. 😘😘😘
.

hello avocado ice cream! 🥑🥑🥑 just avocado, coconut milk, maple syrup, and mint extract if you want the whole mint chocolate chip vibe (WHICH I DO). I like to leave it a little on the soft side so it resembles something between soft serve and ice cream shop scoops. ☀️👌🏼 it's too easy.
.
2 avocados
1 can coconut milk
1/2 cup maple syrup
1/2 tsp mint extract
1/3 cup chocolate chips to mix in
.
blend avocados, coconut milk, syrup and mint extract. stir in chocolate chips and freeze for a few hours until solid. enjoy your happy summer the end goodbyeee 🍦🍦🍦

TRUE FACT: a perfect spring Saturday is only one batch of lemony zucchini muffins away.👌🏼 took a lemon olive oil zucchini cake recipe from the archives and converted it into muffin form and I'm pretty sure all is right in the world.
WHISK:
2 cups grated zucchini
zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups loosely packed brown sugar
1 1/2 cups olive oil
ADD:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
OPTIONAL ADD:
a knob of freshly grated ginger
chia or poppy seeds
a tiny pinch of nutmeg

BAKE:
350 degrees for 15-20 minutes
FYI:
Press the moisture out of the grated zucchini for best results // serve with steamy mugs of coffee because WHAT ELSE.

MAPLE GLAZED PUMPKIN MUFFINS! ☕️❄️💯 Just the smell of the house tho. That's some MAGIC. Recipe right here right now👇🏼Happy Saturday!
--
STIR TOGETHER:
3 1/2 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon each cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon salt
--
WHISK:
3/4 cup sugar
2 cups pumpkin puree
1/2 cup olive oil
1/4 cup maple syrup
3 tablespoons milk
3 eggs
--
Combine mixtures together. Bake in muffin tin at 350 for 15-18 minutes.
--
GLAZE:
2 tablespoons melted butter
1 1/4 cup powdered sugar
1 tablespoon maple syrup
1-2 tablespoons water
--
Makes 18-20-ish muffins!

hello PUMPKIN GRANOLA!! served w maple yogurt, honey, and flakes sea salt? YES YES YES. sponsored by our fav @chobani. this granola is sweet, crunchy, and a little salty which is actually totally amaze. anybody made this yet?? 😋😋💛💛
.
ingredients:
6 cups rolled oats
1 heaping cup sliced almonds
1 heaping cup pistachios (or other nuts)
1 heaping cup unsweetened flaked coconut
1 cup pumpkin puree
1 cup olive oil
1 cup maple syrup
2-3 teaspoons salt
1-2 teaspoons cinnamon
maple or pumpkin Chobani yogurt 😍
.
mix the dry ingredients together. whisk the wet ingredients and spices together. pour wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and stir to combine. bake at 350 for 15 mins, then stir and bake for 15 mins more. be advised that if you use a different type of nuts, they might burn faster! so either watch it carefully or add them at the end of the bake time.
.

if it’s not crunchy you can give it a few more minutes - I like to bake somewhere between 30-40 minutes for the perfect browned crunchiness. it will also crisp up as it cools.
.
let it all cool, eat w your yummy yogurt, taste all your fall dreams come truuue. ❤️✨ recipe inspired by my girl @thefauxmartha and her bomb granola!
.
That's northern Wisconsin for ya. 😎⛅
Don't mind if I do.

3 Ingredient Creamy Tomato Pasta! ❤️ made with CASHEWS. this trick will make your pasta sauces creamy, velvety, and nutritious with no butter or cream.
.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
1 pound pasta
1 jar tomato sauce
2 cups cashews
½ cup water
garlic clove (optional)
herbs and salt to taste
.

HOW TO MAKE IT:
1. Cook pasta and toss with sauce in pan on low heat
2. Blend the cashews, water, garlic, and salt until smooth. Reserve half in the fridge, and add other half to the pasta pot and stir
3. Top with salt, pepper and herbs
.

👆🏼 MANGO CHICKEN TERIYAKI
--
SHAKE IN A JAR:
1/4 cup soy sauce
1/4 cup mirin
1/4 cup honey
1 clove smashed garlic
1 tablespoon fresh ginger paste
--
Pour half of sauce over one pound chicken pieces. Marinate 1-2 hours.
--
Stir fry chicken with 1/2 onion. Add 2 cups diced mangos and remaining sauce. Top with green onions, serve over rice. 👌🏼 Be filled with mango joy.
--
Juicy sweet mangos for the win! 💯 Like, guys. I just SO love the versatility of this fruit. I've also made this recipe with puréed dates instead of honey and it's bomb.

return of the power combo! simple + clean egg salad made w avocados 🥑😍 no mayo here! just five ingredients: avocados, eggs, herbs, lemon juice, and salt. especially good on a huge toasted everything bagel, for health reasons obvi.
.
you need:
2 avocados
8 hard-boiled eggs
a handful of dill
a handful of parsley
juice of one lemon
a pinch of salt
.
mash and mix, basically. works for breakfast, lunch, and din. if you want to make ahead, I'd boil all the eggs since they keep fine in the fridge, but mix half of ingredients together to start (2-3 servings). it probably only keeps for 1-2 days max, so eat it fast and then mix up the second half later in the week. thanks for the recipe inspo @twopeasandpod 👏🏼

WALNUT BACON-WRAPPED DATES! 👅 my favorite for a fauxfancy happy hour. sponsored by @cawalnuts. here's the deal: if you haven't had these, or some variation, you haven't lived. soft, caramely Medjool dates are getting stuffed with tangy goat cheese and buttery walnuts. but we're not stopping there: wrap that baby up in smoky bacon and bake it to crispy perfection. finish it off with a honey glaze and chives, and you’re winning. 💅🏼💅🏾💅🏽 I cannot even with these.
.
we buy our walnuts in bulk (thank you Costco) and keep them in the fridge. pantry/fridge essential!
.
you’ll need:
8 slices of bacon (sliced in half)
16 dates, pitted and halved
16 walnuts
4 ounces goat cheese
2 tbsp honey
minced chives
.
stuff your dates with goat cheese and a walnut, wrap with bacon and secure with a toothpick. bake at 375 for 15-17 minutes. brush with honey. mwah! 💋
.

theee BEST granola bars that are actually soft when you make them and stay soft for later! 🏆 using peanut butter, honey, vanilla, oats, pretzels, peanuts and any other add-ins you like. Saturday project starts now 🙌🏼
.
IN A BOWL:
2 cups rolled oats
2 cups pretzels, crushed down to about 1 heaping cup
½ cup salted peanut halves
.
IN ANOTHER BOWL:
1 cup peanut butter (more as needed)
½ cup honey (more as needed)
1 teaspoon vanilla
.
Stir the two bowls together and press the mixture into a 9x9-inch pan lined with parchment paper, freeze for 30 mins, and cut into bars. I store mine in the fridge or freezer!

cozy day alert! ❤️❄️🔥 meet THE BEST DETOX LENTIL SOUP made completely from vegs and herbs and and lentils and then made creamy with a heavy handed glug of olive oil and a quick trip through the blender. awesome for your mouth / amazing for your bod. 💪🏼
.

IN THE SLOW COOKER:
2 cups butternut squash (peeled and cubed)
2 cups carrots (peeled and sliced)
2 cups potatoes (chopped)
2 cups celery (chopped)
1 cup brown lentils
¾ cup yellow split peas (or just use more lentils)
1 onion (chopped)
5 cloves garlic (minced)
8-10 cups vegetable or chicken broth
2 teaspoons herbs de provence
1 teaspoon salt (more to taste)
.

cook on low for 7-8 hrs or high 5-6 hours. pulse 4 cups of soup with 1/2 cup olive oil (rosemary infused olive oil is my favorite!) until creamy and return to pot. .
.

ADD:
2-3 cups kale (stems removed, chopped)
1 cup parsley (chopped)
a splash of red wine vinegar or lemon juice for a nice little bite
.

butternut squash ravioooli! 👅 this little hack will blow your mind. just make your filling (butternut squash is ideal) and stuff it in between two ... wonton wrappers! ✨ then boil, top with sauce (current fave is kale pesto) and be proud of your mad skills. homemade pasta perfection. 👌🏼
.

whir up in a food processor or blender:
4 cups cooked butternut squash
1 cup whole milk ricotta
½ cup grated Parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons olive oil
nutmeg, garlic, thyme, and/or sage (just season how you like)
pinch of salt and pepper
.

put little scoops of filling on round or square wonton wrappers (also could be gyoza wrappers), brush with beaten egg, and place a second one on top. boil for 5 minutes, drain, and top with sauce! highly recommend kale pesto and parm.
.

SPICY SOUTHWEST TOT DISH! 🔥meatless and delicious with sautéed mushrooms and jalapeños, bell peppers, corn, black beans, and a pepperjack-queso-type base to hold it all together. put those sweet potato tots (or regular) on top and bake and you've got yourself a cast iron skillet miracle for your Thursday night dinner.
.

here's how:

3 tablespoons butter
1 onion, chopped
3 cloves garlic, minced
3 red/yellow bell peppers, chopped
2 poblano peppers, chopped
16 ounces fresh mushrooms, stems removed, chopped
1 tablespoon cumin
1 tablespoon chili powder
¼ cup flour
¾ cup milk
1 pound pepperjack cheese, cut into cubes
1 14-ounce can black beans
1 cup frozen corn
salt to taste
1-2 bags sweet potato tater tots
.

in a cast iron, melt butter with veggies and spices until soft and yummy. stir in flour until sticky. add the milk slowly, stirring after each addition, until smooth. add the cheese and stir until melted. stir in the black beans and corn. taste and season with salt. top the whole thing with tots! bake for 20-30 minutes. BEWARE THE BUBBLING OVER - put a pan underneath to catch any drips! top with the usual suspects. 😏

IN THE SLOW COOKER:
4 cups regular brown lentils
2 onions, diced
4 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon minced ginger
4 tablespoons butter or oil (optional but nice)
5 tablespoons red curry paste
1 tablespoon garam masala
1½ teaspoon turmeric
2 teaspoon sugar
a few good shakes of cayenne pepper
about 5 1/2 cups of tomato puree
about 7 cups of water
1 teaspoon salt plus more to taste
.

cook on high for 4-5 hours or low for 7-8 hours. stir in 1/2 cup coconut cream or real cream at the end to make it nice and rich.
.

okay you know what fine, if spring doesn’t want to ~be a thing~ around here we’ll just go ahead and eat it instead! we’ve got some serious rainbow/food mashup vibes happening with these @soyvay teriyaki spring rolls (uhh, highly HIGHLY underrated spring roll flavor btw). plus once the sun actually decides it would like to join the party we’ll be wanting to spend less time in the kitchen during the week, and more time doing anything that involves outdoor warmth - this recipe happens to be 👌👌👌 for that.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
you’ll need:⠀
1 tablespoon olive oil⠀
14 ounces boneless skinless chicken breasts (cut into small, thin pieces)⠀
1/3 cup Soy Vay Teriyaki Sauce, plus more for dipping⠀
4 ounces cooked rice noodles⠀
2 large carrots, cut into matchsticks⠀
1 1/2 cups thin pineapple slices⠀
2 cups shredded red cabbage⠀
1 cup fresh cilantro⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
cook the chicken: sauté 1 lb. of sliced chicken in a little bit of oil in a pan until chicken starts to brown. add the teriyaki sauce and simmer until chicken is cooked through. remove from heat and set aside.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
assemble the rolls: soak a rice paper wrapper in a bowl of water for about 30 seconds. when pliable, remove and set it on a clean, flat surface. in the middle of each wrapper, place pieces of chicken, a small pile rice noodles, a small handful of carrots, 2 pineapple slices, a small handful of cabbage, and a few cilantro leaves. roll it all up and serve with more teriyaki sauce!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

.
SAUTE:
8 large cloves of garlic, minced
2 tablespoons of butter (oil for vegan)
.
BOIL:
6-7 cups veg broth or water
5-6 cups cauliflower florets
(reserve 1 cup liquid)
.
BLEND:
Cooked cauliflower
Sautéed garlic/butter
1 cup cooking liquid
Salt
Pepper
1/2 cup milk (non dairy for vegan)
.
Top with parmesan, parsley, pepper, etc. and enjoy!

first day of fall! 🍁 this pumpkin spice tres leches cake is here for us and it is NOT joking around. it’s soaked in three types of cream + a long pour of the new limited edition Baileys Pumpkin Spice. I just said that: Baileys Pumpkin Spice. this is our real life right now. here’s how to make magic in your fall kitchen tonight:
.

WHISK:
4 eggs
2 cups sugar
1 cup whole milk
8 tbsp melted butter
.

ADD:
2 cups flour
2 tsp baking powder
1 tsp each salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg
1/2 tsp cloves
.

bake in a 9x13 for 30-40 minutes at 350°. cool for 10 minutes and poke lots of holes in cake.
.

WHISK:
1 cup Baileys Pumpkin Spice (!!)
1 cup sweetened condensed milk
1 cup heavy cream
1 1/2 cups evaporated milk
.

pour over cooled cake and chill for 3 hours. top with whipped cream, caramel, and pecans.
.

this guy has a crusty outside, soft and chewy inside - perfect for dunking in all your fall soups! such as detox lentil soup (pictured here) or pumpkin walnut chili (on the blog this week) or chicken wild rice soup just if you needed some inspo 🤑
.

3 cups all purpose flour

.
mix all these 👆🏼but don’t knead. just literally mix w a wooden spoon in a bowl. cover and let it rest at room temp for 12-ish hours.

tomorrow: stick a big Dutch oven in a 450 degree oven for 30 min to get it hot. then transfer your dough to the hot pan and bake covered for 30 mins + uncovered for 15 to get it golden and crispy on the outside.

spicy vegan carrot soup 💣 also known as THE BOMB DIGGITY. made with just coconut milk, onions, carrots, garlic, curry paste, and - wait for it - peanut butter! cook it in the instant pot / blend it up. it's velvety magic, and bonus: health goals 💪🏼💪🏽💪🏾
.
YOU NEED:
8-10 large carrots
1 onion
3 cloves garlic
1 14-ounce can coconut milk
1 1/2 cups veg broth
1/4 cup peanut butter
1 tbsp red curry paste (video says chili paste but it should be curry paste 😽)

meet the best chocolate pie I've ever made, and surprise! it's conveniently a five-ingredient, no-bake, vegan miracle. sponsored by @almondbreeze. here's the kicker: the ultra-thick pie filling is made with (wait for it)… tofu, almond butter, almond milk, and melted chocolate chips (dairy-free for official vegans).

hi friends 👋🏼 I wanted to write more of a personal message tonight to give you the back story for our upcoming recipe series. As many of you may know, Bjork and I recently experienced the premature birth and loss of our son, Afton, after a precious 15 hours with him. These last few months have been heavy with the deepest grief and heartache we've ever known. And for me, those emotions have come hand-in-hand with losing my appetite.
.

We've been so fortunate to have such a rockstar community of people supporting us, both online (hi! that's you!) and in person. We've had nearly ten weeks straight of soups, lasagnas, tacos, and enchiladas dropped off on our doorstep by people who love us and love Afton. These gifts have not only fed us - they've helped me to find a little joy in food again.
.

That's why I'm calling this series Feeding a Broken Heart.
.

We would LOVE to have you join our mini-movement during this series to honor our son's life and support your people. Here's how:
.

1) Think of someone who has a broken heart. A break up, a loss, a diagnosis... got your person?
.

2) Make them one of the comfort food recipes in this series (like today's recipe: creamy potato soup 👆🏼). Have them over for dinner, or drop it off on their doorstep. Or if you don't live close - email a bite squad / ubereats gift card. Or snail mail chocolate chip cookies. So many ways to do this.
.

3) Show us how you're participating by using the hashtag

we use the super easy @breadin5 brioche dough recipe (just google it) and that's what I'd recommend, but if you're a time saving diva, canned crescent rolls also work just fine - just use two cans instead of one and press the seams together so it makes more of a dough sheet. .

DOUGH:
a half-batch (or a little more) of SUPER EASY @breadin5 brioche
OR 2 cans of crescent rolls, rolled out into one big sheet
.
FILLING:
8 ounces cream cheese (regular or light)
1 cup fresh raspberries
⅓ cup light brown sugar (mix all together)
.
GLAZE:
1 cup powdered sugar
4 teaspoons milk (whisk together)
.
TOPPINGS:
raspberries, sliced almonds, pecans, or turbinado sugar
.

hello September bread season! 💰💰 this gem is one of only two types of bread that I ever make and it is appropriately called MIRACLE NO KNEAD BREAD. here's what you do:
.

tonight: mix 3 cups flour, 1 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon instant yeast, and 1 1/2 cups water in a bowl. just use a wooden spoon. it will be lumpy and you'll be doubtful, but trust the miracle. cover bowl w plastic and wait overnight.
.

tomorrow / 12 hours later: remove plastic, shape into a ball coated w flour, and let it rest for 30 minutes as your pan and oven preheat. bake in a hot Dutch Oven (heavy cast iron with a lid) at 450 degrees - 30 minutes covered w lid, then 15 minutes uncovered. .
.

and just like that, you are a bread master. your Sunday soups will not know what to do with themselves. crusty on the outside, chewy on the inside. carb lyfe is a good lyfe. ✌🏼️ .

recipe sponsored by our favorite @lodgecastiron and full recipe deets are at link in profile
http://pinchofyum.com/no-knead-bread

ok guys, meet the most bizarrely yummy curry! 🍒👅 sweet, spicy, easy, nutritious. sponsored by @choosecherries, made with just coconut milk, spicy red curry paste, spinach, mango, and dried Montmorency tart cherries. the best part is that after a little simmer, the cherries get plump and juicy with all those natural juices rehydrated. 👌🏼
.
ingredients:
1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
2 tbsp red curry paste
1 can coconut milk
1 1/2 cup frozen mango
1 cup dried Montmorency tart cherries
1 packed cup spinach
1/4 cup cilantro
Salt and pepper to taste
.
how to make it:
cook chicken for a few mins and then add curry paste. add coconut milk, mango, and dried Montmorency tart cherries. simmer for 10 mins. stir in spinach and cilantro and cook until wilted. serve over white, brown, or cauli rice. ✨
.
you can visit choosecherries.com for more delicious and nutritious tart cherry recipes 💋

😳🍓 sooo strawberry avocado caprese salad is a thing that is, in fact, CRAZY yummy. and so easy. made w/ strawberries, avocados, mozzarella, and basil / finished off with some balsamic reduction and a sprinkle of salt. one bite and you're in literal food heaven. on cloud nine. reaching next level salad status.
.

I know some people make this with strawberries AND tomatoes, but that sorta weirds me out, so we went with just strawberries and thought it was perfect. ❤️
.

MAKE SOME MAGIC:
1 1/2 cups sliced strawberries
1 avocado
8 ounces fresh mozzarella
tons of fresh basil
salt, pepper, and balsamic reduction to taste
.

balsamic reduction can be made by simmering balsamic vinegar over low heat until thick and syrupy. or you can buy it as a reduction in some grocery stores with the other vinegars.
.

honestly cannot say enough good things about this combo. it is so sweet and creamy and fresh all at the same time, with just the right amount of tangy punch.
.

did you know you can make your own HOMEMADE cream of chicken soup! 😱💪🏼 no junk, no can, totes clean. all you need is milk, chicken broth, flour and some seasoning. easy (clean) casseroles, coming right up.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
ingredients:
2 1/2 cups chicken broth
1 1/2 cups milk
3/4 cup flour
1 tablespoon seasoning mix (or on your own, 1/2 tsp. onion powder, 1/2 tsp. garlic powder, 1/2 tsp. black pepper, 1 tsp. salt, 1/2 tsp. parsley, etc)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
combine broth and 1/2 cup of the milk in a saucepan and bring to a low boil. in a separate bowl, whisk the flour and seasonings into the remaining milk until smooth. pour the flour/milk mixture into the saucepan over low heat and stir continuously until simmering and smooth.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
add to your favorite casseroles or soups and enjoy!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Whooooa yeah. 😍

crumble your cake, stir with 1 can of frosting and 1/2 tsp extract and 1 cup chocolate chips, roll into balls, chill, dip in almond bark or chocolate or white chocolate, and decorate.

Rainbow Veg Pad Thai! 😱🌈💕 fast, easy, and adaptable to whatever veggies you have. made with a simple five ingredient pad thai sauce you can just shake up in a jar!
.
PREP: spiralize or chop your veggies (zucchini, bell pepper, onion, carrots) and saute until slightly softened. place 4 oz of rice noodles in cold water to soften.
.
SAUCE: shake 3 tbsp fish sauce (or a vegan fish sauce sub), 3 tbsp brown sugar, 3 tbsp broth, 2 tbsp white vinegar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, and 1 tsp chili paste in a jar.
.
COMBINE: add 1 tbsp oil to the pan and add softened noodles. add the sauce and stir fry until thickened. push the noodles to the side and add a beaten egg. add the vegetables and toss everything to combine.
.
top with peanuts and herbs and serve! .

[sponsored by @chobani] how bout that avocado green goddess dip! 🌿💚🌿 nutritious and yummy ft. whole milk Greek yogurt, avocado, garlic, and a big ol pile of herbs. just toss it in the food processor and serve it with your favorite dippers. summertime party hero. 😎
.
BLEND:
1 avocado
1 cup whole milk @chobani Greek Yogurt
1/4 cup chives
1/4 cup flat parsley
1 tbsp tarragon
1 clove garlic
2 tbsp water
1 tsp salt / pepper
.
I like to blend the avocado, Greek yogurt, and garlic first, and then add the herbs to finish it off so there's still some green flecks in it. serve this beauty with veggies, chips, or any other summery dippers!
.

creamy chicken gnocchi soup 💙 made creamy in a slow cooker, without heavy cream. using a veg + chicken + herb base, some evaporated milk to make it creamy, and gnocchi and bacon and spinach to make your mouth happy. ohhhh winter.
.

this soup and that no knead bread is currently being super cozy and saving my liiiife after two weeks of travel. Europe was amazing, but home sure feels good.
.

IN THE SLOW COOKER:
1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts
2 cups mirepoix (celery carrots + onions)
1-2 teaspoons dried basil
1-2 teaspoons Italian seasoning
1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
1 teaspoon salt (++)
4 cups chicken broth
.

ONCE COOKED, ADD:
3 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 2 tablespoons water
2 12 ounce cans evaporated milk
2 1 lb. packages mini potato gnocchi (about 4 cups)
6 slices fried crumbled bacon
1 cup sautéed spinach (with garlic!) .

cook a little longer till thick and creamy! thin it out with milk or water as needed and dunk that buttered bread right in.
.

recipe sponsored by @delallofoods - we use and love their adorable mini gnocchi 👌🏼

the most bomb dot com mashed potatoes... in the instant pot! 😭😭😭 they are so creamy, so fluffy, and SO GOOD. from start to finish in 30 minutes, all in one pot.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in the instant pot:
add about 2.5 lbs peeled russet potatoes, 1 tsp salt, and 4 cups water. cook on the steam setting for 12 minutes, release steam right away, and drain.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
on the stove:
melt 1/4 cup butter and 1/4 cup olive oil in a pan and add 2 cloves of garlic with some rosemary and thyme. let it all infuse. discard the herbs and garlic, but reserve butter/oil. 🙏
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
all together:
mash the potatoes in the instant pot and add the infused butter/olive oil, 1/2 cup cream cheese or sour cream, and 1 tsp salt. mix it all up until creamy and serve!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

this week I shared a post about my tendency to rush rush rush, and my current quest for a slow fall rhythm. 🍁🍂❤️ please, my heart says: more slow, more peace, more rest. today was every idea in that post coming true in real life: the friends, the food, the mountain views (park city knows what's hot), the crisp air, my softest knit hat, and the truffle hot chocolate bar - they are all being so good to my soul right now. .
.

just remember, friends: you're worth it. you're worth that Slow Down. if you're sick, take a nap. if you've been working long hours, go put sweatpants on and order a pizza and with your friends. if you just need to breathe a little deeper, take a long walk or get yourself some bomb takeout or hop in the car and get away for a day or two - just go do something good for yourself this weekend, okay? it's called a Slow Down and you're worth it.
.

Cilantro Lime Chicken and Lentils! 💃 Perfect for the instant pot or slow cooker. Throw everything in, set it, and have a healthy, flavorful dinner in just 30 minutes. MAGIC. ✨
.
COMBINE:
2 cups dried lentils
1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
3 cups salsa verde
3 cups chicken broth
1/2 small onion, chopped
3 scallions, chopped
1/2 cup cilantro, chopped
3 cloves garlic
2 jalapeños, diced (ribs and seeds removed)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
.
Cook on the soup setting for 30 mins. Serve with rice and a squeeze of lime. Enjoy & be amazed!
.

also should work with slow cooker - just increase liquid a bit, cook 8 hours or so. Chicken probably only needs 4 hours so add it halfway if you want to be really on top of it.

let's talk sweet potato noodles. ❤️🏆 these are the current champion of my heart bc they make eating healthy salads into more like a noodle-palooza food fest. I see all you noodle lovers out there and I think you need to try 💋
.

SWEET POTATO NOODLES:
2 sweet potatoes, peeled and spiralized!
2 cups roasted corn
1 cup chopped cilantro
1 cup chopped spinach
½ cup pepitas
.

CHIPOTLE DRESSING:
⅓ cup olive oil
3 tablespoons water
2 chipotle peppers
1 clove garlic
1 teaspoon honey
juice of one orange
juice of one lime
generous pinch of salt
.

INSTRUCTIONS
Heat olive oil in a skillet - add the sweet potato noodles and toss until tender crisp.
.

Pulse the dressing ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Toss dressing with the noodles and salad ingredients and you're good to go!
.
Totally appropriate right before dinner. Totally.
