"Grief is love's souvenir. It's our proof that we once loved. Grief is the receipt we wave in the air that says to the world: Look! Love was once mine. I love well. Here is my proof that I paid the price." - Glennon Doyle Melton
.

On January 1st, 2017, I held my first and only son, Afton, as he died in my arms. He was just one day old. Today would have been / was my first Mother's Day as a mom.
.

In the spirit of not just faking my way through posting another recipe, today I want to acknowledge all those for whom Mother's Day delivers grief as a Love Souvenir. Today I am celebrating the love and light of moms everywhere while also holding those who hurt close in my heart, because I'm right there with you. I'm in your club this year.
.

Earlier this week I wrote a post about how to support friends who have lost a baby, and to be honest I was unsure about sharing it on IG, because as this account grows, so does the number of people who don't know our personal story. But then @real_simple reached out and asked if they could syndicate my post as a special piece for Mother's Day, and that gave me confidence and reminded me that grief finds us all, food-loving instagrammers included, and I'm not going to win any awards by pretending this day isn't hard for me.
.

We all know someone - that friend has lost their child, the one whose dream for a family is falling apart, or the one who is navigating Mother's Day without their mom. The one must-do thing is to just acknowledge their pain and the fact that they are bravely walking forward without a piece of their heart. You can literally say: "I want to acknowledge how hard today must have been for you."
.

You can read the rest of the post by clicking the link in my profile, but really, if you have a hurting friend in mind, I'd rather have you take a minute right now and send them a text. It will mean more than you know.
.

Wishing an extra gentle Mother's Day to the grievers. Hold onto each other and that love souvenir. 💙
.

http://pinchofyum.com/what-to-do-when-your-friend-loses-a-baby
.

snack attack level ten 💋😭👌🏼 you know the classic chocolate-covered peanut butter rice krispie bars? if you are from the Midwest, you definitely know these. I basically grew up on them. good news : these are “modern scotcheroos” with 5 ingredients and minimal refined sugar, thanks to a few updated swaps! my favorite, and even though they’re not particularly Christmasy, they are always the first to go on a holiday dessert tray. don’t mind if I do.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
ingredients:
1 cup brown rice syrup (or good ol corn syrup if you want to stick with the original)
1 cup peanut butter
1/4 cup real maple syrup
6 cups brown rice krispies
1 24-ounce bag of dark chocolate chips
a generous pinch of flaked sea salt
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
melt brown rice syrup, peanut butter, and maple syrup until a smooth mixture forms. add a pinch of sea salt and stir in the brown rice krispies and press into a 9×13 pan. melt chocolate chips and pour over bars and finish with a sprinkle of sea salt. let it set until solid, then cut and devour.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Romance is: Scallops + Parmesan Risotto, enjoyed at home with a lil white wine. 💋👌🏼💋👌🏼 I get so many snaps and pictures sent to me from people who make this recipe - makes me so happy! Happy Valentine's Day!
--
PARMESAN RISOTTO:
1 tablespoon butter
1 minced clove garlic
1 cup arborio rice
1/2 cup white wine
3-ish cups of warm chicken broth
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
--
Melt the butter, soften the garlic. Add the arborio rice, stir to coat with butter. Add white wine and enjoy the sizzles. Add the broth, 1/2 cup at a time, and simmer/stir after each addition until the rice is soft and creamy. Add the parmesan. Salt + pepp to taste.
--
JUMBO SCALLOPS:
1 tablespoon grapeseed oil
1 pound jumbo scallops
--
Heat oil in nonstick skillet. Pat scallops dry and add to pan. Shake gently to prevent sticking. After 3 or so minutes, flip each scallop over. They should have a pretty golden brown exterior while staying soft and barely translucent inside. And if you really want to take things to next level status, make a few tablespoons of browned butter and pour it over the top. --

DIVA PRO TIP: blend a handful of cashews straight into your hot coffee and it will become a creamy gift from heaven. 💝 and with a lil honey and sea salt? completely over the top awesome. round here we call this miracle CASHEW COFFEE. <swipe pics to see evidence of smooth coffee creaminess with cloud-like froth>
.

I loved reading your comments on yesterday's post and seeing all your posts of cashew coffees this morning! so happy you guys love it as much as I do! for me it is a total coffee game changer.
.

HOW TO:
blend about 2 cups brewed hot coffee with 1/4 cup cashews and a squeeze of honey and a pinch of sea salt. blend, starting slow and getting faster, for about 45 seconds, ending with the last 10-15 seconds on super high speed. blendtec or vitamix blenders are best. if your blender is good, no need to strain. it should be smooth and incredibly lovable straight out of the blender. 😘☕️ for iced version, soak/drain/rinse cashews first and then blend with cold brewed coffee and serve over ice.
.

what involves yellow cake mix and butter and goes well w Netflix binge nights? this retro pumpkin dessert, that’s what. 😱✨ it’s even better than pie imho, which is a bold claim. it’s like a pumpkin pie base, w buttery yellow cake party on top, and house smells that will make you crazy. like, crazy happy. so yummy.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
recipe:
1 can pumpkin (15 oz)
1 can evaporated milk (12 oz)
1 cup white sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
4 beaten eggs
1 tsp. cinnamon
1/4 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. ginger
1/2 tsp. cloves
1 15-ounce box yellow cake mix
1 C butter, melted
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix the pumpkin, evaporated milk, white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, cinnamon, salt, ginger, and cloves, and then pour into a 9 X 13 pan. sprinkle dry cake mix over top, pour melted butter over it. bake at 375 for about 1 - 1 1/2 hours or until the middle is set.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

that feeling when the BEST cauliflower soup is also the easiest. 😍 just five ingredients and ultra creamy. all you need is an onion, cauliflower, butter, broth, and cheese. SO EASY.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
you'll need:
2-3 tablespoons butter
1 yellow onion
6 cups chicken broth
1 head cauliflower cut into florets
1 heaping cup cheese (your choice!)
1 tablespoon truffle oil if u fancy
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
heat the butter, add the onions, and saute until softened. add the broth and cauliflower and simmer until the cauliflower is fork tender. puree mixture until the soup reaches your desired consistency. add the cheese and stir until melted. add the truffle oil and stir to incorporate. we like top ours with croutons, kale pesto, and more cheese. 👌🏼 YUM!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

hands up if you've made these homemade peanut butter cups! ❤️every time I make these I can't believe they have just 5 ingredients and zero refined sugar. I get so many pictures sent to me of you guys making these! 🙏easy to swap almond butter or any other nut butter, too!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
for the chocolate:
3/4 cup melted coconut oil
1/2 cup cocoa powder (more or less to taste)
2-4 tablespoons natural sweetener (I like agave or maple syrup - more or less to taste)
pinch of salt
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
mix all the ingredients together. pour a little chocolate into the paper cups. drop a small spoonful of peanut butter or almond butter into the center of each cup and divide remaining chocolate amongst the cups. top with sea salt and freeze!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

WE MADE A HEALTHIER ALMOND JOY ARE WE BILLIONAIRES YET? 🤷🏼‍♀️💰 no but furreal, these are the answer to all of your sweet-tooth prayers, and when you remember you have them in the fridge? PSHHHHHHHHH. welcome to The Good Life. 🙌🏼
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
you'll need:⠀
2 1/2 cups flaked coconut, unsweetened⠀
1/4 cup + 1 tablespoon coconut oil⠀
1/4 cup pure maple syrup⠀
1/2 teaspoon vanilla⠀
12 whole almonds⠀
4 ounces dark chocolate for topping⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
in a food processor, pulse coconut until fine crumbs form. add the coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla and pulse until combined.⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
press mixture into a parchment-lined pan and chill for an hour, or until firm. cut into 12 pieces and press one almond into each. melt your chocolate in a bowl and dip/coat each piece. freeze until set and enjoy!⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

how to *really* win the super bowl: make homemade oreos! 🍫🍫🍫 super soft and loaded with cream cheese frosting, so obviously, life changing and game-day necessary. recipe below for ya!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
COOKIES:
1. mix 1 box chocolate cake mix, 2 eggs, 3/4 cup butter, and 1/2 tsp vanilla.
2. roll into balls and place on a baking sheet.
3. bake at 350 degrees for 8 minutes.
4. remove and let cool.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
FROSTING:
1. mix 4 oz. cream cheese, 1/4 cup butter, 1/2 tsp vanilla, and 1 cup powdered sugar.
2. transfer frosting into a pastry bag (or, get real, a plastic bag with the corner cut!)
3. assemble cookies and frosting into sandwiches and enjoy! I like mine refrigerated, please and thank you.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

blueberry crisp! light on refined sugar and heavy on summer lovin. this beauty is literally foolproof-level easy and bonus: it can and should be eaten for breakfast. hello, OATS, duh. 💕
.
ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats
1 cup pecan halves
½ cup almond meal
½ cup unsweetened flaked coconut
pinch of salt
pinch of cinnamon
¼ cup + 2 tablespoons olive oil
⅓ cup real maple syrup or honey
4 cups fresh blueberries
.

mix topping ingredients. in the dish, layer the blueberries, then add the topping. bake for 25-35 mins at 350 until bubbly and then let it rest/set. ...or not! it's yummy either way.
.

pro tip: cover with foil if it's getting too brown too fast. sometimes I top it with a little glaze, sometimes serve with ice cream, sometimes yogurt, sometimes straight up cold out the fridge. I make this maaany times every summer and this summer we've made it at all our workshops! best best best. 👑

(TAP MORE FOR FULL RECIPE 👅👇🏼) Just a heads up: if you come over to my house basically anytime between now and New Year’s, you and I will be sitting down to a big bowl of these Jumbo Scallops + Parmesan Risotto because OH MY GOSH. This simple, luscious holiday splurge is basically life.
--
PARMESAN RISOTTO:
1 tablespoon butter
1 minced clove garlic
1 cup arborio rice
1/2 cup white wine
3-ish cups of chicken broth
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
--
Melt the butter, soften the garlic. Add the arborio rice, stir to coat with butter. Add white wine and enjoy the sizzles. Add the broth, 1/2 cup at a time, and simmer/stir after each addition until the rice is soft and creamy. Add the parmesan. Salt + pepp to taste.
--
JUMBO SCALLOPS:
1 tablespoon grapeseed oil
1 pound jumbo scallops (from ALDI!)
--
Heat oil in nonstick skillet. Pat scallops dry and add to pan. Shake gently to prevent sticking. After 3 or so minutes, flip each scallop over. They should have a pretty golden brown exterior while staying soft and barely translucent inside. And if you really want to take things to next level status, make a few tablespoons of browned butter and pour it over the top.
This recipe post is sponsored by @ALDIUSA - look for Jumbo Scallops in stores (12/16, while supplies last).
